ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Question about ArchiveReader Iterator
ygData.msgSnippet: Sounds like a bug to me too.  hasNext should at least have the appearance of being an idempotent operation. St.Ack

Sounds like a bug to me too.  hasNext should at least have the 
'appearance' of being an idempotent operation.
St.Ack

Mathew Nik Foscarini wrote:
>
> That does sound like a bug to me.
>
> A work around would be to create a wrapper iterator class, and pass 
> the ArchiveReader iterator to that class's constructor. Then check if 
> hasNext has been called more then once for each next().
>
> Or, see if you can fix the ArchiveReader iterator and share the code. :-)
>
> */Christoph Buescher <sterntaufe@...>/* wrote:
>
>     exactly in this order and always one after each other. This, however,
>     seems to be a very strict constraint for a standard Java-Iterator. The
>     problem arises because I don't want to load all the records right
>     away,
>     but let out processing pipeline request new records from an ArcReader
>     when it needs one. In our scenario we can't assure that the client
>     using
>     the ArcReader is well-behaved and always gets the next record after
>     right after calling "next()". It might just want to know several times
>     if there is something left to process and then get the record some
>     time
>     later...
>
